channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How to Generate an AI Podcast Using Google’s NotebookLM
item.description: A little-known AI notebook tool from Google is going viral for its Audio Overviews that mimic the speech cadence of podcasters. Here’s how to try it o...

item.title: AI coding startup Poolside raises $500M from eBay, Nvidia and others
item.description: Poolside, the AI-powered software dev platform, has raised half a billion dollars in new capital. The cash came in the form of a Series B led by Bain ...

item.title: OpenAI raises $6.6B and is now valued at $157B
item.description: ChatGPT maker OpenAI has closed the largest VC round of all time. The startup today announced that it raised $6.6 billion in a funding round that valu...

item.title: Coperni’s Spray-On Dress Was a Viral Smash. This Gravity-Defying Gel Bag Might Top It
item.description: The sci-fi-loving fashion house has partnered with Disney to make an eco-friendly bag that could signal a shift in 3D-printed apparel.

item.title: J.B. Hunt and UP.Labs launch venture lab to build logistics startups
item.description: Transportation and freight network giant J.B. Hunt is on the hunt for software and digital products that will fuel its business and help it adapt to t...

item.title: 5 Best Food Dehydrators, Tested and Reviewed
item.description: We put some of the most popular food dehydrators to the test with beef jerky, fruit leather, and dried flowers.

item.title: Facebook says it paid content creators $2B this year
item.description: Are creators sleeping on Facebook? Though the social network has been more enticing for AI Shrimp Jesus than young people, Facebook is consolidating i...

item.title: Pavel Durov Defends Telegram's Privacy Changes Amid User Unrest
item.description: After Telegram founder Pavel Durov’s arrest in France, the platform has made several changes that seemingly make it friendlier to authorities.

item.title: Hurricane Helene Shows How Broken the US Insurance System Is
item.description: Many homeowners in North Carolina won’t be insured against flooding or landslides due to the fragmented way in which disasters are covered.

item.title: This Week in AI: OpenAI is stretched thin
